page.title: 18HOPE BOWDLER AND CHELMICK
page.content: Hope Bowdler is south east of Church Stretton. It is a very small quiet village. Every year there is a fete at the Church Hall to raise money for the Church. The first Church was built about{ {1237 but it was knocked down in 1862 and was rebuilt from local stone and finished in{1864.} There are no shops or pubs in Hope Bowdler though some residents would like one. There is one horticultural nursery in Soudley. Two years ago there was a Post Office which sold sweets and stamps but in{1981}it was converted into a house. There are two barns, one is now a house and one is still being altered. Chelmick is in a quiet valley. The farmers' land is very bumpy but some fields grow corn.
